com.miviclin.droidengine2d.graphics

Class Graphics

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.miviclin.droidengine2d.graphics.Graphics

  • public class Graphics
extends Object
    The Graphics class allows rendering things on screen without needing to know how rendering in implemented internally.
    Author:
    Miguel Vicente Linares

      • initialize

        public void initialize()

        See Also:
        loadMaterialRenderers()

      • drawText

        public void drawText(CharSequence text,
            BitmapFont font,
            Vector2 position,
            float fontSizePx,
            Color color)
        Renders text.
        Parameters:
        text - Text to render.
        font - Font to be used.
        position - Position of the top-left corner of the first letter of the text.
        fontSizePx - Text scale in pixels.
        color - Text color.

      • drawText

        public void drawText(CharSequence text,
            BitmapFont font,
            Vector2 position,
            float fontSizePx,
            Vector2 rotationPoint,
            float rotation,
            Color color)
        Renders text.
        Parameters:
        text - Text to render.
        font - Font to be used.
        position - Position of the top-left corner of the first letter of the text.
        fontSizePx - Text scale in pixels.
        rotationPoint - Rotation point (anchor).
        rotation - Rotation angle.
        color - Text color.

      • setBackgroundColor

        public void setBackgroundColor(Color color)
        Sets the background color of the GLView to the specified Color.
        Parameters:
        color - Color.

      • flush

        public void flush()
        Flushes the current material renderer, rendering the remaining elements.
        This method should be called once at the end of each frame to ensure that all elements are rendered.
